result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy W. Roe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination, when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

164 day credit in the event of revocation ONLY. Not to be applied to conditional jail time.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work/school/treatment or combination. No objection to EMP. May transfer jail to Shawano or Lincoln Co. 45 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 2:17 pm
INCLUDES 15CF538 AND 15CM628. 
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Andrew Morgan;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF538:
Ct. 1- Delete 'Second and Subsequent Offense' and 'Repeater' Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Carry Concealed Weapon-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.

15CM628:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-PTAC-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CF538:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF538:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 5 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: 201 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/Counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 164 Days Credit to not be applied to Jail time, but in the event of revocation. No objection for Defendant transfering Jail time to Shawano County or Lincoln County. Jail time to be started within 45 days.
